The first computer & programmers in the Netherlands, by Onno Zweers.

In 1953, at the Shell lab in Amsterdam, the first electronic calculator was taken into production in the Netherlands. Shell's new computer was called Miracle, and it was not just an invention; it was a collection of several inventions. To name a few: RAM memory, magnetic memory, electronic printers, instruction sets, monitors.

more at:
http://www.t-dose.org/2008/talk/first_dutch_programmers

Technical Dutch Open Source Event.
October 26, 2008
Fontys Eindhoven.
title: T-DOSE 2008, The first computer & programmers in the Netherlands, Onno Zweers
